Code 0: No diagnosis identified
N/A
Code 1: Mixed anxiety and depressive disorder (mild)
Diagnosis confirmed by: mixture of neurotic symptoms not meeting other diagnostic criteria
Code 2: Generalised anxiety disorder (mild)

Diagnosis confirmed by: mental or physical tension usually with autonomic symptoms (e.g. dizziness, sweating, pounding heart). The symptoms are not restricted to particular environmental circumstances unlike phobic anxiety
Code 3: Obsessive–compulsive disorder

Diagnosis confirmed by: compulsions are repetitive behaviours that are regarded as senseless by the patient, are upsetting and if stopped lead to anxiety. Obsessions are repetitive, intrusive and upsetting thoughts
Code 4: Mixed anxiety and depressive disorder
Diagnosis confirmed by: mixture of anxiety and depressive symptoms not meeting other diagnostic criteria
Code 5: Specific (isolated) phobia
Diagnosis confirmed by: an unreasonably strong fear or avoidance of specific things e.g. spiders, heights
Code 6: Social phobia
Diagnosis confirmed by: an unreasonably strong fear or avoidance of social situations: meeting and speaking to people, speaking in public, eating out. Often associated with low self-esteem.
Code 7: Agoraphobia
Diagnosis confirmed by: an unreasonably strong fear or avoidance of leaving home, crowded shops, and public transport. Usually worse when unaccompanied.
Code 8: Generalised anxiety disorder

Diagnosis confirmed by: mental or physical tension usually with autonomic symptoms (e.g. dizziness, sweating, pounding heart) occurring most days for several weeks. The symptoms are not restricted to particular environmental circumstances unlike phobic anxiety
Code 9: Panic disorder

Diagnosis confirmed by: unexplained attacks of anxiety or fear that begin suddenly, develop rapidly and may only last a few minutes. Attacks usually associated with autonomic symptoms: palpitations, chest pain, sensation of choking, churning stomach, dizziness, feeling of unreality and feeling of impending doom. Often associated with phobic anxiety and avoidance.
Code 10: Mild depressive episode

Diagnosis confirmed by: at least 2 core depressive symptoms and at least 4 total diagnostic depressive symptoms (CORE = low mood for at least 2 weeks, loss of interest or pleasure, fatigue/loss of energy; OTHER = disturbed sleep, low self worth, appetite/weight change, guilt, poor concentration, agitation or slowing of movement/speech, suicidal thoughts or acts) [text modified from original CIS-R]
Code 11: Moderate depressive episode

Diagnosis confirmed by: at least 2 core depressive symptoms and at least 6 total diagnostic depressive symptoms (CORE = low mood for at least 2 weeks, loss of interest or pleasure, fatigue/loss of energy; OTHER = disturbed sleep, low self worth, appetite/weight change, guilt, poor concentration, agitation or slowing of movement/speech, suicidal thoughts or acts) [text modified from original CIS-R]
Code 12: Severe depressive episode

Diagnosis confirmed by: all 3 core depressive symptoms and at least 8 total diagnostic depressive symptoms (CORE = low mood for at least 2 weeks, loss of interest or pleasure, fatigue/loss of energy; OTHER = disturbed sleep, low self worth, appetite/weight change, guilt, poor concentration, agitation or slowing of movement/speech, suicidal thoughts or acts) [text modified from original CIS-R]

This computerised questionnaire will ask you a range of questions about yourself, your symptoms, and your health and well-being.

Your answers will be kept confidentially, like any medical notes. The information you give will be treated in strict confidence and will only be used for research purposes.

Touch the screen to answer, and touch the green arrow pointing to the right (at the top right corner of the screen) to proceed.

Please touch the green arrow at the top right now, for further instructions.

Some people have phobias; they get nervous or uncomfortable about specific things or situations when there is no real danger.
